result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean E Peplinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber privileges  for work, school and AODA treatment.
Court approved participation in the Dosage Probation Pilot Program. Probation may be terminated early if the defendant successfully completes the program and all other conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes: Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge. To be paid by 5/13/2014.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
No drivers license suspension.
Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification course and a parenting course.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sean E Peplinski in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 1 day, Huber privileges for work, school and AODA treatment. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS.   Court approved participation in the Dosage Probation Pilot Program and probation may be terminated early if the defendant successfully completes the program and all other conditions of probation.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Part time work or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Successfully complete a parenting course
-Complete 40 hours of community service
-No drivers license suspension
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 5/13/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 5/13/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Dosage Probation Approved. sab

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Sean E Peplinski not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sean E Peplinski not in court, defendant in custody. Nick Cerwin for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant was interviewed by Atty. Darryl Smith and is eligible for public defender representation. Case calendared for STATUS of COUNSEL on 4/14/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Sean E Peplinski not in court, defendant in custody. Marissa Santiago for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant is in Washington County jail and needs to be interviewed for public defender eligiblilty. Case calendared for STATUS of COUNSEL on 3/31/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Sean E Peplinski in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Sean E Peplinski in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court grants Atty. Canfield's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel. Case calendared for STATUS of COUNSEL on 3/20/2015 at 8:30 am. Public defenders office notified by email of need of evaluation.

Attorney Jason Canfield in court, defendant Sean E Peplinski not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant needs to be produced. Case rescheduled for MOTION HEARING on 3/11/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
to Withdraw received and filed. sab

Defendant Sean E Peplinski in court with attorney Jason Canfield. David Behm for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
This case may be a DPA case. Case calendared for DPA/Motion Hearing on 2/26/2015 at 10:00 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Sean E Peplinski in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case is rescheduled for MOTION HEARING on 1/20/2015 at 3:00 pm in Branch 15.

Attorney Jason Canfield in court.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant is in rehab in Oshkosh. Defense is asking for an adjourned Motion date.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 12/12/2014. Case calendared for MOTION HEARING on 12/12/2014 at 10:00 am in Branch 15.
State's Brief in Opposition to Defendant's Motion to Suppress received and filed. sab
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence, received and filed. sab

Defendant Sean E Peplinski in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Phyllis M. DeCarvalho appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 15.  Motions shall be filed by 9-23-2014; response due by 9-30-2014.  Motion hearing scheduled for 10-16-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sean E Peplinski in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Counsel was just retained and has no discovery as of yet. Case calendared for STATUS on 9/3/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Sean E Peplinski in court with attorney Thomas Grieve by phone calls.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant appears late.  He drives from Green Bay and ran into construction.  Court vacates the bench warrant reinstates the bail.  Defendant states he has contacted Attorney Radtke and is making arrangments to hire him.  Court allows Attorney Grieve to withdraw as counsel of record.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.

Attorney Thomas Grieve in court.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Sean E Peplinski in court with attorney Thomas Grieve.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant has made arrangements with a new attorney.  However, the attorney is not able to appear today due to a family emergency.   If Attorney Grieve can turn over discovery to the new counsel prior to the next date, he does not have to appear.  Status conference scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sean E Peplinski in court with attorney Thomas Grieve.  Kevin R Shomin for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant states he wants new counsel.   Attorney Grieve moves to withdraw.  Court grants motion subject to new attorney appearing at the next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sean E Peplinski in court with attorney Thomas Grieve.  Kevin Shomin for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Per Commissioner Laura Gramling Perez approved (authorized) waiving time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sean E Peplinski in court.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant has private attorney Tom Grieve which is unavailable for today's proceedings. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/20/14 @ 1:30pm
